    Comparing brix degrees and number of fruits between cultivars

    brix_fruits.Rmd

    Import

    library(stRawberry)

    Is there any difference in brix degrees and number of fruits between Albion, San Andreas and Portola?

    # Create a list containing all experiments and other list with measures
experiments <- c("Solo", "Deitado", "Dupla", "Em pé")
measure <- c("brix", "frutos")

# Cross all possibilities
crossed <- tidyr::crossing(
  experiments,
  measure
)

purrr::map2(
  crossed$measure,
  crossed$experiments,
  ~ diffAnalysis(var = .x, experiment = .y)
) %>% purrr::set_names(
  paste0(
    crossed$measure, " no experimento ", crossed$experiments)
) %>% 
  purrr::map(~ .x[[2]])
#> $`brix no experimento Deitado`
#>                     Diferença  Inferior Superior         p
#> Portola-Albion           0.75 -1.777412 3.277412 0.6957149
#> San Andreas-Albion       0.75 -1.777412 3.277412 0.6957149
#> San Andreas-Portola      0.00 -2.527412 2.527412 1.0000000
#> 
#> $`frutos no experimento Deitado`
#>                     Diferença  Inferior Superior         p
#> Portola-Albion           0.85 -1.607917 3.307917 0.6152632
#> San Andreas-Albion      -0.40 -2.857917 2.057917 0.8937318
#> San Andreas-Portola     -1.25 -3.707917 1.207917 0.3716679
#> 
#> $`brix no experimento Dupla`
#>                     Diferença  Inferior Superior         p
#> Portola-Albion          -0.25 -3.099579 2.599579 0.9675834
#> San Andreas-Albion      -0.25 -3.099579 2.599579 0.9675834
#> San Andreas-Portola      0.00 -2.849579 2.849579 1.0000000
#> 
#> $`frutos no experimento Dupla`
#>                     Diferença  Inferior Superior         p
#> Portola-Albion         -0.075 -1.081134 0.931134 0.9764660
#> San Andreas-Albion      0.275 -0.731134 1.281134 0.7336563
#> San Andreas-Portola     0.350 -0.656134 1.356134 0.6119208
#> 
#> $`brix no experimento Em pé`
#>                         Diferença   Inferior  Superior        p
#> Portola-Albion      -6.000000e-01 -1.6671455 0.4671455 0.325305
#> San Andreas-Albion   1.776357e-15 -1.0671455 1.0671455 1.000000
#> San Andreas-Portola  6.000000e-01 -0.4671455 1.6671455 0.325305
#> 
#> $`frutos no experimento Em pé`
#>                     Diferença  Inferior  Superior          p
#> Portola-Albion           0.28 -1.754118 2.3141185 0.92879008
#> San Andreas-Albion      -1.64 -3.674118 0.3941185 0.12099778
#> San Andreas-Portola     -1.92 -3.954118 0.1141185 0.06494027
#> 
#> $`brix no experimento Solo`
#>                      Diferença   Inferior   Superior          p
#> Portola-Albion       0.7678571 -0.2768745  1.8125888 0.17648930
#> San Andreas-Albion  -0.3571429 -1.4018745  0.6875888 0.66799815
#> San Andreas-Portola -1.1250000 -2.1343067 -0.1156933 0.02733804
#> 
#> $`frutos no experimento Solo`
#>                      Diferença   Inferior   Superior            p
#> Portola-Albion      -12.988107 -15.699907 -10.276308 3.354192e-10
#> San Andreas-Albion   -8.717357 -11.429157  -6.005558 2.630876e-07
#> San Andreas-Portola   4.270750   1.650903   6.890597 1.460818e-03

    As we can observe in the Tukey test output, there are significant differences in the brix degrees and number of fruits only in the “Solo” experiment.
